Package me.dessie.dessielib.resourcepack.assets

Class BlockStateAsset

java.lang.Object
me.dessie.dessielib.resourcepack.assets.Asset
me.dessie.dessielib.resourcepack.assets.BlockStateAsset
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.bukkit.event.Listener
public class BlockStateAsset extends Asset implements org.bukkit.event.Listener
This class ONLY tells the ResourcePack what specific BlockStates should be replaced with a specific texture. This class will not generate any textures or model files, BlockAsset to generate and copy custom texture/model files. This class also adds functionality to these custom BlockStates, through the use of consumers.

    • BlockStateAsset

      public BlockStateAsset(String name, String replacementName, BlockAsset model)
      Parameters:
      name - The Asset's name
      replacementName - The Vanilla BlockState name to override. For example, "note_block" or "dirt"
      model - A BlockAsset to use as the Override

    • BlockStateAsset

      public BlockStateAsset(String name, String replacementName, org.bukkit.Material model)
      Parameters:
      name - The Asset's name
      replacementName - The Vanilla BlockState name to override. For example, "note_block" or "dirt"
      model - A Material to use as the override. If you're having issues with this, you may need to manually find the name of the BlockState json file.

    • BlockStateAsset

      public BlockStateAsset(String name, org.bukkit.Material replacement, String model)
      Parameters:
      name - The Asset's name
      replacement - A Material to Override. If you're having issues with this, you may need to manually find the name of the BlockState json file.
      model - The model to replace the replacementName with. For example, "minecraft:diamond_block" or "dessielib:custom_block"

    • BlockStateAsset

      public BlockStateAsset(String name, String replacementName, String model)
      Parameters:
      name - The Asset's name
      replacementName - The Vanilla BlockState name to override. For example, "note_block" or "dirt"
      model - The model to replace the replacementName with. For example, "minecraft:diamond_block" or "dessielib:custom_block"

    • getReplacementName

      public String getReplacementName()

      The name of the file to use within the resource pack.

      public Map<String,String> getPredicates()

      The vanilla predicates that must be met for this state to be valid.

      Returns:
      The properties for this state asset.

    • getStrength

      public double getStrength()
      Returns:
      The custom strength for this block. Strength is used when determining how long a block should take to mine.

    • getDrops

      public List<org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack> getDrops()
      Returns:
      What ItemStack the block should drop.

    • getPreferredItems

      public List<org.bukkit.Material> getPreferredItems()
      Returns:
      Which Materials are preferred when breaking this block.

    • isPreferredItemRequiredForDrop

      public boolean isPreferredItemRequiredForDrop()
      Returns:
      If a preferred material must be used to get drops from this block.

    • getMinecraftBlockStatesFolder

      public File getMinecraftBlockStatesFolder()
      Returns:
      The folder that contains the minecraft block state resources. Resolves to serverDir/plugins/pluginName/assets/minecraft/blockstates

    • getModel

      public String getModel()
      Returns:
      The String reference to the model texture. For example, minecraft:block/anvil dessielib:block/custom_block

    • getBreakSpeed

      public double getBreakSpeed(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item, org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Parameters:
      item - The ItemStack that is being used to break the block.
      player - The Player that is breaking the block.
      Returns:
      How quickly the player can mine the block with that ItemStack.

    • addPredicate

      public BlockStateAsset addPredicate(String key, String value)
      Adds a predicate that is used to determine when this asset should be applied to the material. Blocks have different types of predicates that can be used. You may need to reference the internal Minecraft resource pack to find valid keys and values for the block you're using.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the predicate. For example, "facing".
      value - The value of the predicate. For example, "west".
      Returns:
      The BlockStateAsset instance.

    • addProperty

      public BlockStateAsset addProperty(String key, Object value)
      Adds a property that is applied when this asset is being applied to a block. For example, y=90 will rotate the block on the y-axis by 90 degrees. You may need to reference the internal Minecraft resource pack to find valid keys and values for the block you're using.
      Parameters:
      key - The key of the property. For example, "y".
      value - The value of the predicate. For example, "90".
      Returns:
      The BlockStateAsset instance.

    • addPreferredItems

      public BlockStateAsset addPreferredItems(org.bukkit.Material... materials)
      Materials within this List will break this block faster. This method only obeys Axes, Pickaxes, Shovels, and Hoes. This method does nothing if the strength is -1.
      Parameters:
      materials - The preferred Materials to add
      Returns:
      This BlockStateAsset

    • setStrength

      public BlockStateAsset setStrength(double strength)
      The strength of this BlockStateAsset. If it's -1, the break speed will be unmodified. If it's changed, the break speed will be calculated and the API will attempt to mimic this break speed. For strength examples, see net.minecraft.world.level.block.Blocks.class, as this is where you can find default values. Some block examples: Obsidian: 50 Stone: 1.5 Dirt: 0.5 Planks: 2.0
      Parameters:
      strength - The Strength of the block
      Returns:
      This BlockStateAsset

    • setPreferredItemRequiredToDrop

      public BlockStateAsset setPreferredItemRequiredToDrop(boolean required)
      If true, one of the Preferred ItemStack materials must be used for anything to drop.
      Parameters:
      required - If a preferred item is required or not.
      Returns:
      This BlockStateAsset

      public BlockStateAsset addDrops(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack... items)
      When this block is destroyed, items from the drop list will be dropped instead of the default item.
      Parameters:
      items - The ItemStacks that this BlockStateAsset should drop.
      Returns:
      This BlockStateAsset

    • addEventListener

      public <T extends org.bukkit.event.Event> BlockStateAsset addEventListener(Class<T> type, BiPredicate<BlockStateAsset,T> predicate, Consumer<T> consumer)
      Adds an EventListener to this BlockStateAsset, that will callback your methods when the event is triggered and the predicate is met. Generally, your predicate will use blockMatches(Block) to make sure the Block matches this asset.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The class type of event to listen for
      Parameters:
      type - The Event class
      predicate - The Predicate that should be met to fire your listener.
      consumer - A consumer that accepts the event
      Returns:
      This BlockStateAsset

    • addEventListener

      public <T extends org.bukkit.event.Event> BlockStateAsset addEventListener(Class<T> type, BiPredicate<BlockStateAsset,T> predicate, Consumer<T> consumer, org.bukkit.event.EventPriority priority)
      Adds an EventListener to this BlockStateAsset, that will callback your methods when the event is triggered and the predicate is met. Generally, your predicate will use blockMatches(Block) to make sure the Block matches this asset.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The class type of Event to listen for
      Parameters:
      type - The Event class
      predicate - The Predicate that should be met to fire your listener.
      consumer - A consumer that accepts the event
      priority - The Event's priority
      Returns:
      This BlockStateAsset

    • blockMatches

      public boolean blockMatches(org.bukkit.block.Block block)
      Tests if a Bukkit Block matches this BlockStateAsset All state properties must match for this to return true.
      Parameters:
      block - The Block to chest
      Returns:
      If the Block matches this BlockStateAsset's properties.
